item.title: Comment on Classical Homeopathy For Chronic Migraine by ANNAPOORNA
item.dc:creator: ANNAPOORNA
item.description: I had severe migraine problem since childhood. Now I am 63, retired, but when I was working, just to get rid of that pain and go for work, i used to take many pain killers. Since may be 10 years, I am free from this problem after Dr seema & Dr mahesh treated me.
item.content:encoded: I had severe migraine problem since childhood. Now I am 63, retired, but when I was working, just to get rid of that pain and go for work, i used to take many pain killers. Since may be 10 years, I am free from this problem after Dr seema & Dr mahesh treated me.

item.title: Comment on Wellspring Meds Is Your New One-Stop Shop For Medications and Supplements! by Mia Jones
item.dc:creator: Mia Jones
item.description: The medication I need is out of stock. Gas Relief | Simethicone 125 mg | Extra Strength 365 Count SoftGels I've never run into this issue with Wellspring. But I'm not surprised, you guys have the best quality meds, best prices, best deals. I'm actually surprised it hasn't happened before, now that I think about it. But my question is, finally, is how long will it take to get it in stock? Thank you so much for your time and attention. I look forward to hearing from you soon. Hope you have wonderful day! Stay safe
item.content:encoded:
The medication I need is out of stock.
Gas Relief | Simethicone 125 mg | Extra Strength 365 Count SoftGels
I’ve never run into this issue with Wellspring. But I’m not surprised, you guys have the best quality meds, best prices, best deals. I’m actually surprised it hasn’t happened before, now that I think about it.
But my question is, finally, is how long will it take to get it in stock?
Thank you so much for your time and attention. I look forward to hearing from you soon.
Hope you have wonderful day!
Stay safe üôè

item.title: Comment on 5 Things You Should Know About Grief by Patty Walling
item.dc:creator: Patty Walling
item.description: Thank you. My beautiful daughter left us just a little over 2 years ago and the grief can overwhelm me. Knowing that I am not alone in this helps me. I share about her all the time. I feel if I don't then everyone might for get her. That would be like saying she was never here. I don't know how I do the days sometimes but I do. Her birthday is coming up and it is difficult. I will cook her favorite meal and her cheesecake. I will celebrate her birth. She was 47 years old when she passed.
item.content:encoded:
Thank you. My beautiful daughter left us just a little over 2 years ago and the grief can overwhelm me. Knowing that I am not alone in this helps me. I share about her all the time. I feel if I don’t then everyone might for get her. That would be like saying she was never here. I don’t know how I do the days sometimes but I do.
Her birthday is coming up and it is difficult. I will cook her favorite meal and her cheesecake. I will celebrate her birth. She was 47 years old when she passed.

item.title: Comment on Things To Consider When Buying Gym Clothes by Gwenn
item.dc:creator: Gwenn
item.description:
Thank you for your articles. I must admit this particular one was very confusing, and not terribly specific in several paragraphs. Early on, I was great with "The material should have a cotton composition of between 80-90%." Which I love -- however 80% cotton is almost impossible to find in gym clothes. Except perhaps a T-shirt. Further in the article, you seem to recommend polyamides (nylon) as the lightest. I agree, however nylon is super hot in warm weather.
The more expensive (high-end supposedly according to retailers) the yoga pant is (for example) the higher the lycra + other fabrics are contained within. I am a fitness and yoga instructor, buying moderate-to-pricey gym leggings for 30 years, and there is no cotton really to be found. Any recommendations? I'll take 'em.
I agree with finding reviews -- wish I was smart enough to check Facebook. Now, I will.
Again, my thanks for your website and articles, and the opportunity to comment.
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for your articles. I must admit this particular one was very confusing, and not terribly specific in several paragraphs. Early on, I was great with “The material should have a cotton composition of between 80-90%.” Which I love — however 80% cotton is almost impossible to find in gym clothes. Except perhaps a T-shirt. Further in the article, you seem to recommend polyamides (nylon) as the lightest. I agree, however nylon is super hot in warm weather.

The more expensive (high-end supposedly according to retailers) the yoga pant is (for example) the higher the lycra + other fabrics are contained within. I am a fitness and yoga instructor, buying moderate-to-pricey gym leggings for 30 years, and there is no cotton really to be found. Any recommendations? I’ll take ’em.

I agree with finding reviews — wish I was smart enough to check Facebook. Now, I will.

Again, my thanks for your website and articles, and the opportunity to comment.

item.title: Comment on Chronic Back Pain: Should You See A Chiropractor? by Katherine V
item.dc:creator: Katherine V
item.description: I would like to thank you for this very objective article about the benefits of Chiropractic Care!! It is a beyond time to acknowledge the benefits. I want to point out that membership in the ACA is not a requirement for licensure. This is a group similar to the American Medical Association for MD's. There is no educational requirement for membership, doctors simply pay their dues. There are additional educational certifications that could be beneficial depending on a person's specific issues including: CCSP -Certified Chiropractic Sports Physician, thru the American Chiropractic Board of Sports Physicians, DACBR - Diplomate, American Chiropractic Board of Radiology, DICCP - Diplomate in Clinical Chiropractic Pediatrics.
item.content:encoded:
I would like to thank you for this very objective article about the benefits of Chiropractic Care!! It is a beyond time to acknowledge the benefits.
I want to point out that membership in the ACA is not a requirement for licensure. This is a group similar to the American Medical Association for MD’s. There is no educational requirement for membership, doctors simply pay their dues.
There are additional educational certifications that could be beneficial depending on a person’s specific issues including: CCSP -Certified Chiropractic Sports Physician, thru the American Chiropractic Board of Sports Physicians, DACBR – Diplomate, American Chiropractic Board of Radiology, DICCP – Diplomate in Clinical Chiropractic Pediatrics.
